page.title: 07Beswick & Watton C.E. School
page.content: The school is situated on the A164 between Beswick and Watton, close to the Kilnwick crossroads. It provides education for children from 4+ to 11+ years. In September 1985 there will be 25 children on roll - 14 Infants and 11 Juniors. There are 2.1 teaching staff, including Head Teacher, and five part-time ancillary staff. Low numbers have threatened the school's continued existence for several years. A closure attempt was defeated in 1977 on the retirement of the then Head Teacher. Numbers have averaged around 28 since then, peaking at about 35 and dropping to 21 at one time. Projected figures indicate that present trends will continue over the next few years. Kilnwick supplies the majority of the present school population, Beswick and Watton contributing smaller numbers.
